Key Match Events: Brazil had a goal disallowed after a VAR review in the 30th minute.
Lucas Paquetá hit the woodwork twice in the second half.
The match saw several missed chances by Brazil, including a close-range header by Marquinhos and a strike by Guilherme Arana.
Coach Dorival Junior made two substitutions in the 70th minute, bringing on Endrick and Sávio.
Post-Match Reflections: Brazil's coach Dorival Junior expressed frustration with the team's finishing and said they left the game with confidence despite the result.
Neymar, Brazil's all-time leading scorer, was sidelined due to an anterior cruciate ligament injury and looked dejected during the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California, with an attendance of 67,158 fans.
Costa Rica's goalkeeper Patrick Sequeira made several key saves to preserve his team's lead.
